As a reminder, Circleville High School's free and reduced meal designation has been changed by ODJFS and the USDA. High school student breakfasts will now be $2/meal and lunches will now be $3 meal.

You can now complete the Free and Reduced-priced meals application for CHS students only online. Your application will be sent from a secure website directly to Circleville City Schools, so you don't need to worry about filling out a paper form that could be lost or misplaced.

Once your application has been received, Suzie Gerhardt will process the application to determine your eligibility. You will receive a letter with the results. Or, you can create an account on Lunchapplication.com and you may receive your results via email.

Families will need to add funds to their student's EZ Pay account at the high school as a part of our contact-less (cashless) sales procedures.

To apply for free/reduced lunch at CHS, apply here: http://www.circlevillecityschools.org/FoodServices.aspx

Congratulations to Circleville High School senior Connor Jones who will be attending Capital University this fall to study Environmental Science and play baseball.

"I decided to go to Capital University because of the smaller feel and brotherhood they have as a baseball team," said Jones.

Jones is a 3-year letterman in baseball and a 2nd team All-Mid-State League and honorable mention all-District.

In attendance for today's signing day ceremony were Connor's mother Tina, sisters Allison and Sydney, and coach Brian Bigam.
